pronunciation: V'AUNT, [Latin vanus. This ought to be written vant.]To

definitions.text:
Vaunt
 boast; make vain display of one's own worth, attainments or decorations; talk with vain ostentation; brag.Pride - prompts man vaunt and overvalue what he is.V'AUNT,
boast of; make vain display of.My vanquisher, spoil'd of vaunted spoil.Charity vaunteth not itself. 1 Corinthians 13:4.V'AUNT,
Boast; vain display of what one or has, or has done; ostentation from vanity.Him I seduc'd with other vaunts and other promises.V'AUNT,
